tanalysis.sentiment module¶

class tanalysis.sentiment.SentimentAnalyzer(text_type=Type.PLAIN_TEXT)¶

Bases: object

This class is used to perform sentiment analysis on Tweet objects

analyzer¶

A google.cloud LanguageServiceClient instance

type¶

A string that indicates the type of text to be given to the analyzer

analyzeTweets(tweets: List[tanalysis.models.Tweet])¶

Iterates through a given list of Tweet objects, uses the analyzer to perform sentiment analysis on the text, and updates the sentiment_score of each Tweet. If the Google API credentials are not set with an environment variable, the Tweets will be given random values. Finally, this method returns a list of dictionaries with the values the frontend needs to construct a graph of the sentiment of the given Tweets.

Parameters

tweets (List[Tweet]) – list of tweets to analyze

Returns

a list of dictionaries corresponding to each Tweet with the following structure: {‘score’: sentiment_score, ‘timestamp’: timestamp}

Return type

List[Dict]

tanalysis.twittercom module¶

class tanalysis.twittercom.TwitterCom¶

Bases: object

TwitterCom() is a class that aids in forming a list of tweets that will be sent over to analyze the sentiment of a topic.

auth¶

authentication to be used with Tweepy API

Type

Tweepy.OAuthHandler

api¶

used to query Tweepy API

Type

Tweepy.API

findTweets(input: tanalysis.models.Query)¶

When a query has been made, findTweets() will run a search to Twitter’s API based on the query. It returns a response from a search by keyword and number of tweets requested, and from each tweet in that response object, the necessary information to build Tweet objects are stored. It stores the results from the search in a list of Tweet objects.

Parameters

input (Query) – A Query object that contains the keyword and usernames to be used to search for Tweets

Returns

List[Tweet]

getTopTweets(tweets: List[tanalysis.models.Tweet])¶

Returns a list of dictionaries with the “engagement” information about all of the inputted Tweets sent by verified users. This information is used by the frontend in the “Top Tweets” section.

Parameters

tweets (List[Tweet]) – A list of Tweets to search through to find Tweets by verified users

Returns

A list of dictionaries corresponding to each Tweet by a verified user with the following structure: {“tid”: tweet.id, “engagement”: (2*tweet.retweets + tweet.likes)}

Return type

List[Dict]
